value.string: Dev Disclaimer: This bot was written without access to UAT or LIVE/PROD target system for testing
Dev Disclaimer: Assumption is made the Google Chrome is installed and available without "default browser"  popups on start
USAGE: Run to log out of ESR site, using credentials set in credential vault, set strOutput variable to SUCCESS/STOPPED/ERROR (with description)
USAGE: Incoming variables (default values will be used otherwise): numProcessID, boolEnableLoggingSession (optional for triggering logging)
=== Note we do not use a config file for these basic application bots, instead set default values if inputs not provided. ===
Using string for test mode instead of boolean to allow text values direct from a config file, must explicitly be Y or 1 to enable
Process ID will default to zero anyway if not provided, no need to set here for application bots
Set up input defaults where not provided (if appropriate)
Get shortened task name from full CR path - for application bots this can also be used for the bot name
Use strTaskName for strBotName (application bots only)
Create Current Date (format yyyyMMdd) - mainly used for file naming throughout the bot code
Set initial status of task for logging (no need to include the task name)
Avoid using Throw AllErrors, see Stop comments below for more graceful method
Using a boolean combined with "Task Bot: Stop" and a Finally block to signal that task was stopped intentionally (gracefully).
Never set this boolean variable to be an input or output!

value.expression: BEGIN : $strBotName$ Bot - Application Task Started & Initialised - In $strEnvironment$ Environment

value.string: Logging Utility will fail if session not started. Using Error Handling used to prevent bot failure.
As we cannot wildcard the window title for ESR, must check exact window before checking objects in window.
Refresh in case window is stale and login expired
Checks bot has successfully logged in by checking log out button exists.
Check exact window again before checking object in window.
Could not find the "Login" button to validate logout worked
Graceful stop and jump to Finally section
<button tabindex="0" class="OraButton left" message="FND_SSO_LOGIN" onclick="submitCredentials()" style="padding-right: 0px; padding-left: 0px;">Log In</button>
Set final status of task for logging (no need to include the task name)

value.expression: END : $strBotName$ Bot - Application Task Finished - In $strEnvironment$ Environment

value.string: To get here early, use "Throw AllErrors" in main Error Handling
An unexpected error stopped the Bot, what do we do? Be aware it may have been a called task that threw errors
Set strOutput for AA team use
If we do not set the error flag to TRUE, the calling task will not know there was an error and continue as normal
To get here early, use "Task Bot: Stop" anywhere in the task
Set strOutput for AA team use

value.expression:
Arrived at Finally section in task $strTaskName$

bStopTask value: $boolStopTask.Boolean:toString$
bErrorFlag value: $boolErrorFlag.Boolean:toString$

value.string: Bot was stopped gracefully due to a handled failure, what do we do? sLogMessage value should have been set when stop was actioned
Set strOutput for AA team use
Reset error flags and values to prevent calling task quitting entire bot
=== Write ERROR entry to log if not intended to stop the entire bot (sub tasks only) ===
Logging Utility will fail if session not started. Using Error Handling used to prevent bot failure.
Nested Error Handler for cleanup or other non-vital final steps - with no CatchAll or Finally block

variables.name: prompt-assignment
variables.description: A variable you can use for assignments
